Objectively Verifiable Indicators Timescale Progress

text:
Measures within the Logframe ~ Public Health
Objectively Verifiable Indicators Timescale Progress
By 2026-28, life expectancy at birth in Kent will increase by 1.5 years for males and 1 year for 2026
females. Additionally, the slope index of inequality for life expectancy at birth will decrease by 2
years for males and 0.5 years for females.
Mental health - Improve access rates to children and young people’s mental health services for 0-17
year olds, for certain ethnic groups, age, gender and deprivation.
The proportion of adults in Kent who are physically inactive will have fallen from 22.3% in 2020/21 2028
to 20%.
By 2028, the proportion of adults in Kent and Medway who are overweight or obese will have fallen 2028
from 64.1% in 2020/21 to 62%.
By 2028, smoking prevalence in adults in routine and manual occupations (18-64) will have 2028
decreased by 9 percentage points from 28.1% in Kent and 20.1% in Medway in 2021.
Hospital admissions in Kent due to alcohol will have fallen from 418.7 in 2021/22 to 395 per 2028
100,000.
The suicide rate for persons will be similar or better than the England average (England currently 10 2028
per 100,000).
The mortality rate from drug misuse in Kent will remain at a similar level, which is similar to or better 2028
than the national average.
The proportion of children who are up to with the vaccinations in the NHS routine list meets 2028
the national benchmark (95%).

no more than 5% across Kent

2028
to the rate it was in 2018 (4,556 per 100,000).
By 2028, maintain the rate of emergency admissions for those with one or more long term condition 2028
to the level it was in 2024.
By 2028, we will increase the proportion of people who receive long-term support who live in their 2028
home or with family.
By 2028, the people describing their overall experience of making a GP appointment as good will 2028
have increased from 49% in 2022 to at least 60%.
By 2028/29, the percentage of people aged 65 and over who were still at home 91 days after 2028
discharge from hospital into reablement services will have increased in Kent to at least 85%
(2021/22: Kent 84.5%)
